thread.title: Russia Should Expect Casualties in Syria, at Home, Defense Chief Ash Carter Says
thread.title_full: Russia Should Expect Casualties in Syria, at Home, Defense Chief Ash Carter Says - US News

author: USNews
title: Russia Should Expect Casualties in Syria, at Home, Defense Chief Ash Carter Says
text:
Defense Secretary Ash Carter: Russian Deaths in Syria Days Away Cruise missiles, ground forces, aerial bombings in support of Bashar Assad come with a price. Secretary of Defense Ash Carter gives a press conference during a defense minister meeting at the NATO Headquarters in Brussels on Thursday.
By Paul D. Shinkman Oct. 8, 2015 | 12:45 p.m. EDT + More Secretary of Defense Ash Carter offered a cryptic warning to Russia while speaking before fellow NATO military chiefs in Brussels on Thursday, saying their former Cold War foe’s recent belligerence in Syria will soon reap deadly consequences.
“In the coming days, the Russians will begin to suffer from casualties,” Carter said at the ministerial.
RELATED
Ash Carter Demands ‘Unvarnished Intelligence’ Amid Reports of Manipulating ISIS Facts Carter’s remarks come a day after Russia began launching missiles at targets in Syria, and confirmation that Russian air forces have begun supporting a ground offensive by troops from the regime of Syrian President Bashar Assad. Carter’s comments may also hint at what many analysts believe to be true, that Russia is planning or has already deployed special operations forces to wage guerrilla war in Syria, as they reportedly did in eastern Ukraine.
Russia should be “rightly fearful” of attacks of retribution both on the ground in Syria and at home in the form of terrorist attacks for its recently ramped up campaign in Syria, Carter said.
American officials, including Carter, have repeatedly condemned Russia’s actions as unhelpful, particularly as they attack both extremist and U.S.-backed rebel forces there.
On Wednesday – Russian President Vladimir Putin’s birthday – warships in the Caspian Sea began launching cruise missiles against targets in Syria. A Pentagon spokesman also confirmed Wednesday the new Russian interference has on at least two occasions forced warplanes from the U.S.-led anti-Islamic State group coalition to alter their flight paths.
TAGS: Russia Putin, Vladimir
